abstract: 'My heart and who I am are black'.
description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the 'Stolen Generation'. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn't understand why they refuse to talk about it today.
